intro: Opilia ruwenzoriensis, commonly known as the Ruwenzori opilia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the East African Rift Valley. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pentamerous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassland habitats at elevations above 2,500 meters. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Opilia ruwenzoriensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude environments.
